page.title: 11BASINGSTOKE CANAL
page.content: The Basingstoke Canal was completed in 1793 to provide a transport route to London via the Rivers Wey and Thames, but became derelict when better roads and the railway were built. Surrey and Hants Canal Society started restoration in 1974 after these County Councils had purchased the land. The existing canal was built to give a bottom width of 38ft and 6ft depth, but dredging has only been to 29ft and 4ft6ins in order to preserve the unique habitat. The towpath has been cleared and the brick-arched bridges repaired. The narrow boat, JOHN PINKERTON, takes 56 passengers on canal trips. Rowing boats can be hired and permits are available for private boating and also for fishing.
